thread.title: Wall Street has a quiet Friday after volatile week
thread.title_full: Wall Street has a quiet Friday after volatile week | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: Wall Street has a quiet Friday after volatile week
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)U.S. shares ended little changed on Friday after an extreme week of volatility.

By the close the Dow Jones had eased 12 points to 16643. The S&P 500 added 0.1% to 1999 while the NASDAQ climbed 0.3% to 4828.

Data out on Friday did show US consumer spending picked up last month (July) offering a further indication of a possible rise this year.

Wall Street round-up 

In stock news miner Freeport McMoran (NYSE:FXC) nudged almost 2% higher to 10.39 a it emerged activist investor Carl Icahn is now the biggest shareholder in the company

Icahn said he wanted to discuss cuts to Freeport's operations and capital spending and might seek representation on the board.

Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) lost ground after the maker of computer-aided design (CAD) software swung to a second-quarter loss and cut its full-year outlook as it continues to shift to a subscription-based model.

Shares fell 5.3% to US47.27 in New York expanding this yearâ€™s loss to 17%.

Scotiabank (TSE:BNS) Canada's third-largest bank posted a third-quarter profit that topped market expectations helped by growth in its international retail banking segment. Despite that shares ease 0.9% to C59.47.

First Quantum Minerals (TSE:FM) shares were lifted as the miner kicked off production at its 2.1bn Sentinel mine in copper-rich Zambia.
